column4: Is there a way to set different wallpapers for dual monitors in Ubuntu Gutsy?
if you figure out a way to do that, let me know... seems... I ended up just doing some gimp work on my wallpapers, and merged two wallpapers, into 1 file, and it looks pretty good.
I don't mind doing that, but is there a way to move a pasted image to a specific spot? Like, +1440 pixels?
now that i don't know.
have you tried madwifi?
No, how do I enable that?
can you not hook it up via ethernet cable for 10min?
Nope. I don't have access to the router. One sec, ziroday.
there's a lot of threads on ubuntuforums to get that device working, i have it and it works fine...
are you still here?
Yup. Did I miss a suggustion?
no, i'm trying to find something.
Ah, thanks for all the help. :-)
i know how to nstall the device(its actually quite easy), problem is doing it w/o internet access
that won't work unfortunately(well it might, but it would be a serious pain in the..)
Alright, tell me how to do it, then. I'll see if I can get to an ethernet cable sometime soon.
are you using 64bit?
then you should learn to read instructions clearly, i doubt thats gonna work w/ 64bit...
did you disable the driver that it told you to?
Yup.
well, i've done that on 3 different PCs(2 are mine), w/o issue at all and 32bit.
ziroday, works great. Thanks. :)
good to hear... i figured it would work fine w/ 32bit.
